title: Trump's Tariffs Send U.S. Aluminum Prices to Record Highs
summary: U.S. aluminum prices hit a record $4,816 per ton due to tightened inventories caused by the Trump administration's steel and aluminum tariffs. The tariffs, which were doubled to 50%, have significantly reduced imports from Canada, the largest supplier, leading to supply constraints and elevated demand in the U.S. market.

title: U.S. Aluminium Premiums Hit Record Highs Amid Tariffs and Supply Crunch
summary: U.S. aluminum premiums reached historic highs in 2025, driven by 50% import tariffs and global supply constraints. Buyers are paying up to $4,792 per ton, combining the London Metal Exchange price and premiums, reflecting tight supplies and the belief that tariffs will remain permanent without exemptions for Canada.

title: Aluminum Rebounds from 1-Month Low
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose to $2,861.20 per tonne on December 10, 2025, rebounding from a near one-month low of $2,790 on November 18. The price increase was supported by macroeconomic tailwinds favoring manufacturing and fresh stimulus signals from Beijing to address its property crisis.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: The U.S. government increased steel and aluminum tariffs to 50%, aiming to protect domestic production. Despite global steel overcapacity and a downturn in Chinese construction, the tariffs have contributed to rising costs. The approval of a major U.S. Steel sale to Nippon Steel could impact production capacity and pricing dynamics.

title: Iran augments aluminum production in 8M2025
summary: Aluminum ingot production by four Iranian companies increased by 3% to 411,351 tons in the first eight months of 2025. Southern Aluminum led production with 173,108 tons, followed by Iranian Aluminum and Al-Mahdi Aluminum. Iran Alumina also produced significant quantities of aluminum powder and bauxite.

title: Column: China steel exports surge but aluminum shipments slide
summary: China's aluminum production is expected to reach near the 45 million ton annual cap in 2025, with domestic demand reducing exports by 9.2% to 5.59 million tons in the first 11 months. The reduced Chinese aluminum exports have contributed to a rise in global aluminum prices, benefiting Western smelters facing high energy costs.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: Global steel and aluminum production continues to grow led by China despite demand challenges. The U.S. is seeing increased tariffs on aluminum, and Nippon Steel is investing in upgrading U.S. steel production capacity. The report highlights the importance of domestic production and innovation in energy-efficient electrical steels.

title: Canada has been shifting aluminum exports to non-U.S. markets
summary: Canada is redirecting a significant portion of its aluminum exports away from the U.S. market to Europe due to tariffs and market conditions. Canadian producers are operating at full capacity, with the metal either going to the U.S. or European markets depending on pricing dynamics.

title: Steel and Aluminum Tariffs Will Hike Costs - The Conference Board
summary: The U.S. government plans to restore and elevate tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to 25%, with no exemptions for allies. This move is expected to increase domestic prices and escalate trade tensions, particularly with Canada, the largest exporter of aluminum to the U.S. The tariffs will impact industries relying on aluminum such as construction and automotive.

title: SMM: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Inventory Drops 602 mt WoW to 54,700 mt on Dec 11
summary: Domestic inventory of secondary aluminum alloy ingots in China dropped by 602 metric tons week-over-week to 54,700 metric tons as of December 11, 2025. This decline indicates ongoing production growth and tightening supply in the secondary aluminum market.

title: The premium for aluminum in the US spot market has hit a record high
summary: The U.S. spot market aluminum premium reached a record high due to elevated import tariffs and tight global supply. This has increased costs for U.S. consumers and provided some relief to Western aluminum smelters struggling with competitiveness.

title: Across the Aluminum Value Chain: How Collaboration Drives Decarbonization
summary: The ELYSIS joint venture, co-owned by Alcoa and Rio Tinto, has achieved a major milestone by successfully starting up its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at a Rio Tinto smelter in Quebec. This technology replaces carbon anodes with inert materials that emit oxygen instead of CO₂, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions and reducing the carbon footprint of aluminum production by approximately 40%. When combined with 50% post-consumer recycled content, it offers a low-carbon packaging solution linking innovation with consumer products.

title: Novelis Wins German Ecodesign Award for Recycled Aluminium Automotive Sheet
summary: Novelis received the German Ecodesign Award for its production-ready aluminum alloy made with 100% recycled end-of-life automotive scrap. The alloy, Novelis Advanz™ 6F – e170RC, contains at least 75% recycled content and demonstrates the feasibility of true car-to-car aluminum recycling. This innovation supports a circular economy and significantly reduces CO₂ emissions by up to 95% compared to primary aluminum production.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball Corporation and Unilever are using aluminum produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, marking a significant step in sustainable packaging. The cans combine 50% ELYSIS aluminum with 50% post-consumer recycled content, showcasing innovation and supply chain collaboration to decarbonize aluminum packaging and the broader aluminum sector.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever pilot 'carbon-free' smelting technology in personal and home care packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have piloted the use of Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in personal and home care packaging. This pilot highlights the potential for carbon-free aluminum production to reduce the environmental impact of consumer packaging through innovative smelting technology that eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Silicon, aluminum and lithium scarcity threaten green technology development
summary: A study highlights that scarcity and extraction challenges of critical raw materials like silicon, aluminum, and lithium could hinder green technology development essential for sustainability transitions. The research emphasizes the urgent need to improve recycling and reuse of these materials to reduce pressure on natural resources and support green technology deployment.

title: December Steel Price Outlook: Macro & Fundamental Drivers
summary: Steel prices have been volatile recently with hot metal production slightly down but still high. Inventory is expected to decline in December, though destocking for sheets and plates will be slow. Macro factors, including domestic policy meetings, may support limited price rises, but persistent destocking and weak sales could constrain gains.

title: Raw Steels MMI: Steel Prices Hold Steady Ahead of 2025
summary: Steel prices remained consolidated with a slight 1.78% decline from November to December. Lead times lengthened slightly, and mills showed pricing flexibility. The steel price trend is sideways with a notable 37% drop in hot-rolled coil prices year-over-year, while some futures saw modest gains.

title: Steel Drops on Weak Demand
summary: Steel rebar futures in China fell below CNY 3,050 per ton, hitting a near one-month low due to weakening demand and production scale-backs. Only 35% of Chinese steel mills were profitable at the end of November, down from 45% previously, indicating pressure on the market.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: The US increased steel tariffs to 50%, aiming to curb Chinese steel imports and support domestic producers. Despite tariffs, global steel overcapacity persists, and the Chinese construction downturn impacts demand. The US Steel sale to Nippon Steel and potential restarts of blast furnace capacity could temper price increases.

title: China's steel mills deepen output cuts over Oct-Nov as demand margins weaken
summary: China's steel mills continued production cuts in late October and early November due to declining construction demand and weakening profit margins. Despite output reductions, steel prices face resistance from weak domestic demand and high inventories, with production expected to decline further into November and December.

title: Column: China steel exports surge but aluminum shipments slide
summary: China's steel production is informally capped below last year's 1.005 billion metric tons, likely dipping below 1 billion tons in 2025 for the first time since 2019. Weak domestic demand due to a sluggish property sector has led mills to increase exports, which are on track to reach a record high of approximately 117 million tons in 2025.

title: Steel Drops on Weak Demand
summary: Steel rebar futures in China fell to a two-week low amid weakening demand, prompting mills to reduce production. Only 35% of Chinese steel mills were profitable at the end of November. Meanwhile, steel exports rose 2% month-on-month to 9.98 million tons in November, marking a record 107.72 million tons for the year to date.

title: Worldsteel: China's steel overcapacity won't be easy to resolve
summary: Worldsteel highlights that China's steel overcapacity is deeply linked to its economic structure, making quick reductions difficult. Steel demand in China is expected to decline by 2% in 2025 and 1% in 2026, driving record export volumes despite rising protectionism. The global steel market fragmentation also complicates efforts to reduce carbon emissions in the sector.

title: China Steel Exports Surge to New Records in 2025
summary: China's steel exports are projected to hit a record 117 million tons in 2025, driven by weak domestic demand and a sluggish property market. Meanwhile, aluminum shipments have fallen by 9.2% amid changing global demand patterns.

title: Trade minister raises concerns over Canada's steel industry safeguard plan
summary: South Korea's Trade Minister expressed concerns to Canada about its plan to reduce steel tariff rate quotas (TRQs) from 100% to 75% of 2024 levels, which could impact Korean steel exports. The move aims to protect Canada's steel industry amid global oversupply but is seen as violating WTO rules and existing free trade agreements.

title: SMS group presents Plant Assessment Tool for customized decarbonization at worldsteel Breakthrough Technology Conference
summary: At the worldsteel Breakthrough Technology Conference in Singapore, SMS group introduced a data-driven Plant Assessment Tool that helps steelmakers identify the most viable decarbonization pathways tailored to their specific conditions. The tool balances sustainability and profitability by analyzing factors like energy prices, raw material availability, and carbon footprint, enabling informed decisions for reducing CO2 emissions, including retrofitting blast furnaces with electrification.

title: Ode to Noble Laborers
summary: This report highlights innovations in steel technology at Baosteel, including the integration of artificial intelligence in hot-rolling steel processes and breakthroughs in laminar cooling technology that boosted steel product yields. The article emphasizes the role of skilled workers and AI in transforming traditional steel manufacturing towards smarter, more efficient production.

title: Why Green Technology Innovations in 2025 Matter More Than Ever
summary: Green steel production technology with a lower carbon footprint is a vital advancement in reducing the steel industry's 7% share of global greenhouse gas emissions. Key innovations include low-carbon construction, carbon capture systems, long-duration energy storage, hydrogen transport, and circular economy solutions, which collectively drive sustainability and economic competitiveness in steel production.

title: Copper Prices Surge to Record High on Chinese Policy and US Stockpiling
summary: Copper futures reached new all-time highs in early December 2025, driven by Chinese demand policies for 2026 and US stockpiling ahead of tariffs, raising concerns of a global supply squeeze. Analysts expect a global shortfall of refined copper next year and emphasize the need for prices above $12,000 a ton to incentivize new mining investments.

title: Copper Prices Rise Amid China Slowdown
summary: Despite weak economic indicators from China, copper prices have increased as traders focus on tightening physical markets and long-term demand prospects driven by renewable energy, electric vehicles, and data centers. Supply challenges persist due to mine disruptions and difficulties in increasing output, particularly from major producers like Codelco.

title: Anglo American and Teck Resources Merge, US Fed Cuts Interest Rate by 25 Basis Points as Expected [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper futures opened at $11,632/mt and fluctuated during the session, closing with a gain of 0.78%. Spot prices in Shanghai showed a mixed trend with discounts and premiums varying, while imported copper prices saw slight increases. The report highlights ongoing market volatility and supply-demand dynamics in the copper market.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Copper prices fell slightly to $5.30 per pound on December 11, 2025, retreating from four-month highs amid demand uncertainties from China. Over the past month, copper prices have risen over 4%, with a year-on-year increase of about 27%, reflecting strong market momentum despite recent volatility.

title: Assessing Copper's Supply-Demand Dynamics as Prices Soar and Inventories Drop
summary: Copper prices have continuously hit historical highs with a year-on-year increase exceeding 30% on the LME. Global copper inventories have dropped below 1 million tons, intensifying concerns about a copper shortage driven by long-term supply-demand imbalances. Forecasts indicate increasing copper consumption and a growing supply gap by 2035.

title: Copper Hits All-Time Highs! Scrap Prices Surge Heading Into December 2025
summary: Copper futures have broken all-time price records due to speculative buying and algorithm-driven trades, despite weak mill demand in major markets. The surge impacts scrap prices and recycling markets, with recommendations for scrappers to capitalize on the rally while remaining cautious of volatility.

title: Copper bounces on prospects for support for Chinese property sector
summary: Copper prices rebounded towards record levels on hopes of additional stimulus measures in China’s property sector, the top consumer of metals. Market optimism about Chinese policy support is helping to sustain copper prices amid ongoing global supply concerns.

title: Assessing Copper's Supply-Demand Dynamics as Prices Soar and ...
summary: Global copper mine production grew from January to September 2025, with about 558 mines operating worldwide and a total capacity of 29.3 million tons. Despite new projects, supply-side bottlenecks and geopolitical factors constrain resource availability, leading to a projected 30% supply gap by 2035. China is advancing 'Smart Mine' technology to increase mining efficiency and reduce energy consumption, aiming for 800,000 tons of refined copper output in 2025.

title: Copper Prices Rise Amid China Slowdown
summary: Copper prices have risen despite weak economic indicators from China, driven by tightening physical markets and strong long-term demand from renewable energy and electric vehicles. Supply challenges persist with mine disruptions, including difficulties faced by Codelco, the world's largest copper producer. The structural imbalance between demand and constrained supply supports copper prices amid short-term economic concerns.

title: The world needs a lot more copper. But will there be enough supply?
summary: Several key copper mines experienced operational setbacks in 2025, including flooding and tunnel collapses, leading to lowered production guidance. The copper market is expected to enter a supply deficit as early as 2026 due to these disruptions and increasing demand driven by clean energy transitions and electric vehicles. Smelters face profit margin pressures, and any reduction in smelting could further tighten supply.

title: Anglo American and Teck Resources Merge, US Fed Cuts Interest Rate by 25 Basis Points as Expected [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Anglo American and Teck Resources shareholders approved an all-share merger to form Anglo Teck, expected to become the world's fifth-largest copper producer with annual production of about 1.2 million metric tons. The merger aims to achieve $800 million in annual cost synergies within four years. Copper futures showed price fluctuations but closed with a slight gain on December 10.

title: Myriad ups stake in Copper Mountain uranium project in Wyoming to 75%
summary: Myriad Uranium increased its stake to 75% in the Copper Mountain uranium project in Wyoming, highlighting the project's potential to become one of America's largest uranium sources. The project has benefited from new permits and significant past investments, with ongoing drilling exceeding expectations. Wyoming is becoming a hub for uranium activity in the US.

title: Rewiring a sustainable, clean energy future with copper
summary: The article discusses copper's critical role in the clean energy transition, highlighting its efficiency in electricity transmission and its recyclability, which supports sustainability and the circular economy. It emphasizes the mining industry's adoption of responsible practices and technological innovations to meet growing copper demand while minimizing environmental impact.

title: Copper for Tomorrow: Sustainable copper production
summary: The Copper for Tomorrow initiative aims to address challenges in the copper value chain to sustainably increase production, especially from lower grade ores, without increasing energy, water use, or waste. The project focuses on integrating research and innovation to help the copper industry meet environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals while supporting the green energy transition.

title: How Nuton is redefining copper for a low-impact future
summary: Nuton, a Rio Tinto venture, is pioneering bioleach technologies that enable cleaner and more efficient copper production by unlocking new resources with a reduced environmental footprint. Their data-driven and partnership-based approach supports responsible copper mining that aligns with energy transition goals.

title: Rio Tinto starts copper production in Arizona with Nuton technology
summary: Rio Tinto has begun copper production in Arizona using Nuton's bioleaching technology, which significantly lowers carbon emissions and water consumption compared to traditional methods. The technology recovers up to 85% of copper from primary sulfides and supports a cleaner, more domestic copper supply chain critical for the energy transition.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel prices extended their decline
summary: Nickel prices declined with the most-traded SHFE nickel contract closing down 0.7% at 116,920 yuan/mt. The market showed cautious sentiment ahead of the US Fed FOMC meeting, with prices expected to fluctuate between 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt in the short term.

title: Nickel declines as dollar rises on Fed rate outlook
summary: Nickel prices fell as the US dollar strengthened amid uncertainty over Federal Reserve policy and rate cuts. Goldman Sachs forecasts nickel prices to decline by 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026, reflecting cautious market sentiment.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December period I
summary: Indonesia's Nickel Miners Association set the benchmark price for nickel ore at $14,666.67/wmt for early December, down 2.21% from late November. Prices for different nickel grades also declined slightly, reflecting a softening market.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low due to a weak Federal Reserve outlook despite potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Futures on the London Metal Exchange fell as much as 2.3%, with nickel trending 8% lower this year amid concerns over supply and electric vehicle sales slowdown.

title: Why Nickel Still Matters Despite Falling Prices
summary: Despite nickel prices being at a five-year low, the long-term outlook remains positive due to demand from electric vehicles and supply regulations in Indonesia. Immediate supply impacts are limited, but stainless steel demand remains subdued, contributing to price volatility.

title: On December 11, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 116,400 to 121,900 yuan/mt with an average of 119,150 yuan/mt, down 1,200 yuan/mt from the previous trading day, indicating a continued decline in nickel prices.

title: The Morning Post of Nickel on December 11th
summary: Nornickel, a major Russian nickel producer, announced that the global nickel surplus is expected to remain around 150,000 tons by 2025, signaling ongoing oversupply concerns in the market.

title: China nickel sulfate production down 9.14% MoM in Nov
summary: China's nickel sulfate production fell to 206,500 tonnes in November, down 9.14% month-on-month, mainly due to production cuts and weak downstream demand in the ternary precursor industry. Despite this reduction, overall supply remained ample with sufficient inventories, leading to a continued downward trend in nickel sulfate prices.

title: Indonesia nickel matte production up 3.60% MoM in Nov
summary: Indonesia's nickel matte production increased by 3.60% month-on-month to 36,900 tonnes in nickel content in November, with a year-on-year rise of 20.16%. The production included both high-grade and low-grade nickel matte, while the cumulative production from January to November 2025 showed a 7.79% decrease compared to the previous year.

title: Indonesia's nickel matte output rises in November, MHP production edges lower
summary: Indonesia saw an increase in nickel matte output in November while production of mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) slightly declined. This reflects ongoing shifts in Indonesia's nickel production dynamics amid regulatory and market changes.

title: Nickel has a future despite low prices
summary: Nickel prices have dropped to a five-year low due to a persistent global supply surplus, mainly driven by Indonesia's ferronickel output and China's nickel sulfate production. Despite this, long-term demand from electric vehicles and energy storage technologies is expected to support nickel's future market prospects.

title: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals Sign LOI for Nickel Processing Plant in Bell Bay
summary: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals have signed a letter of intent to develop a nickel processing plant in Bell Bay, Tasmania. This project aims to enhance local nickel processing capacity and support the growing demand for nickel in energy transition technologies.

title: Recycling technology achieves 99% purity of nickel and cobalt
summary: A research team at UNIST developed an innovative electrochemical recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with purity exceeding 99%. This method reduces chemical use and wastewater compared to conventional processes, offering a sustainable and efficient solution for battery recycling.

title: Nickel's role in the future of safer electric vehicle batteries
summary: Researchers from The University of Texas at Austin and Argonne National Laboratory studied nickel-based cathodes for EV batteries, focusing on improving thermal stability and safety. Their findings provide a roadmap to develop safer, high-energy-density nickel cathodes that can extend EV driving ranges without compromising battery safety.

title: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals Sign LOI for Nickel Processing Plant in Bell Bay
summary: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals signed a Letter of Intent to develop a nickel processing plant in Bell Bay, Tasmania. This initiative aims to advance nickel processing capabilities, supporting sustainable supply chains and innovation in nickel technology.

title: Turning resources into results: Talon's 2024 achievements set to redefine U.S. critical minerals supply chains in 2025 and beyond
summary: Talon Metals reported significant 2024 milestones including securing over US$137 million in grants to develop environmentally responsible nickel and copper supply chains in the U.S. Their projects focus on minimizing mine tailings and producing valuable by-products, advancing sustainable nickel production technologies.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a significant capital increase of 200 million euros to support its growth and acquisitions, including the acquisition of Special Melted Products (SMP) in the UK. This move strengthens Cogne's position in the stainless steel market and aligns with its sustainability commitments.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne completes acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali, through its subsidiary and backed by Taiwanese Walsin Lihwa Corporation, completed the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes (MST), a US-based tube producer part of Salzgitter AG. This acquisition enhances Cogne's vertical integration, melting capacity, and competitiveness in high-demand industries.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from renewable sources and 93% of its employees have permanent contracts. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali mulls expansion in U.S.
summary: Following four acquisitions in the past two years, Cogne Acciai Speciali is considering further expansion in the U.S. market. The company has secured EUR 245 million through capital increases to fund acquisitions and is preparing for additional growth opportunities in the stainless steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Fifth exit in 2023: Mutares has signed an agreement to sell Special Melted Products to Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Mutares signed an agreement to sell its portfolio company Special Melted Products Ltd. to Cogne Acciai Speciali for approximately EUR 180 million. The transaction, expected to close in Q2 2023, will strengthen Cogne's market position in stainless steel long products and nickel alloys.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling activity
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in North America despite weakness in other regions. The company warned that margins would be affected by the full impact of tariff costs, with EU steel producers operating at reduced capacity due to rising imports and tariffs.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: At the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, Tenaris showcased its steel solutions designed for power generation with a focus on performance and sustainability. The company highlighted its long-term collaboration with Macchi and investments in manufacturing capabilities to produce high-performance steel tubes for extreme conditions, supporting environmental management with certified Environmental Product Declarations.

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy - Tenaris
summary: Tenaris, in collaboration with Snam and Tenova, launched Italy's first trial using hydrogen to process steel products at its Dalmine mill. The six-month project aims to evaluate hydrogen's performance and reliability in steel production to reduce CO2 emissions, supporting Tenaris's goal to cut its carbon footprint by 30% by 2030.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris's Dalmine mill in Italy obtained ASME III certification, qualifying it to supply certified materials for nuclear facility construction. This accreditation supports the company's role in the low-carbon energy transition by enabling it to meet stringent international standards for nuclear energy projects globally.

title: Tenaris is a worldsteel Sustainability Champion for eighth consecutive year
summary: Tenaris was recognized as a worldsteel Sustainability Champion for the eighth year running, reflecting its ongoing investments in operational efficiency and decarbonization. Key projects include upgrades at its Dalmine mill in Italy and expansion of renewable energy use across its industrial system, aiming to reduce emissions intensity by 30% by 2030.

title: Italy's Prysmian sees stronger U.S. pricing, margins after new copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian expects to benefit from the new U.S. copper tariff scheme imposing a 50% levy on foreign-made cables, which will increase costs for importers from countries like Mexico and India. The company, producing cables in the U.S., anticipates maintaining higher prices and improved margins, supported by its vertical integration in copper rod production.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian is investing heavily in R&D in Italy, with €216 million spent between 2021 and 2024 and plans for an additional €270 million by 2028. The Milan R&D center is central to Prysmian's innovation strategy, focusing on energy transition and digital transformation, supported by Italian government funding and initiatives like the Green New Deal for submarine energy cables.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian, after acquiring Texas-based Encore Wire, views the U.S. 50% copper tariff as beneficial for reinforcing local supply chains. The company sources much of its copper domestically and is vertically integrated, positioning it better than competitors to benefit from the tariff, which aims to protect and facilitate local business.

title: PRYSMIAN HONORED AT AMCHAM'S TRANSATLANTIC AWARD GALA DINNER FOR ITS INVESTMENT IN ENCORE WIRE
summary: Prysmian received the Transatlantic Award 2025 for its €245 million investment to expand production capacity at Encore Wire in Texas. This investment aligns with Prysmian's strategy to strengthen its U.S. market presence and modernize energy infrastructure, supporting demand from data centers and industrial reshoring.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting better-than-expected Q3 revenue and earnings, driven by strong performance in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids. The company’s improved outlook is partly attributed to the positive impact of copper tariffs expected to benefit its North American operations in 2026.
